page.title: 13HOSPITALS AND HEALTH
page.content: The Royal Hampshire County{Hospital}is the main hospital, and has about 50 wards. In the children's ward there are lots of toys, televisions and radios. A teacher comes round daily to the children. The hospital has a lot of new buildings:a maternity unit, hospital stores and the ambulance station. Highcroft on the Romsey Road is the Wessex Regional{Health Authority } offices. It used to be owned by a doctor, who left in 1957, when they bought it. They have since built on numerous extensions and the staff has grown from only 15 to over 500.Another hospital at St.Paul's is for 120 elderly patients. Sarum Road private hospital, modernised in 1952, is a surgical and medical unit. It is for fee paying patients and has 7 matrons and 31 beds.
